meanings.definition: To make something into a ritual.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, she would ritualise her breakfast routine by setting the table with care.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to ritualise their Sunday dinners by always cooking together.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally ritualised his morning routine by putting his socks on before his pants!
meanings.sent4: The team ritualised their pre-game warm-up, treating it like a sacred dance.
meanings.sent5: She wanted to ritualise her study sessions to improve focus and productivity.

meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the participants ritualise the traditional dance.
meanings.sent2: Every year, the community comes together to ritualise the harvest festival.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to ritualise their weekly movie night with themed costumes.
meanings.sent4: The monks ritualise their daily prayers, finding peace in the repetition.
meanings.sent5: The athletes ritualise their pre-game routines to mentally prepare for the competition.
